headline: U.S.-China Trade Deal Framework a Bullish Sign for Stocks: Ives
summary: Sunday’s news from administration officials that the U.S. was on track for a trade deal with China, after negotiators hammered out a framework for one over the weekend, is a bullish sign for the markets and tech stocks in particular, according to Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives.  After weeks of (mostly) escalating tit-or-tat between the two sides, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s announcement and the prospect for more progress “would be a huge groundbreaking moment for the tech sector and markets,” Ives said in a note Sunday.  “This continues to be a lingering overhang on tech stocks that could be removed as the far reaching impact around the AI Revolution from chip production, Nvidia/AMD sales into China, software IP complexity, TikTok, and rare earth restrictions are all on the table.”

raw.headline: U.S.-China Trade Deal Framework a Bullish Sign for Stocks: Ives
raw.summary: Sunday’s news from administration officials that the U.S. was on track for a trade deal with China, after negotiators hammered out a framework for one over the weekend, is a bullish sign for the markets and tech stocks in particular, according to Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives.  After weeks of (mostly) escalating tit-or-tat between the two sides, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s announcement and the prospect for more progress “would be a huge groundbreaking moment for the tech sector and markets,” Ives said in a note Sunday.  “This continues to be a lingering overhang on tech stocks that could be removed as the far reaching impact around the AI Revolution from chip production, Nvidia/AMD sales into China, software IP complexity, TikTok, and rare earth restrictions are all on the table.”

headline: Will Luminar Technologies' (LAZR) Revised Outlook Reshape Its Path to Lidar Leadership?
summary: In recent days, Luminar Technologies underscored ongoing partnerships with Volvo, Mercedes-Benz, NVIDIA, and Mobileye, while announcing plans to launch its next-generation Halo lidar chipset and production line by late 2025, with prototype production targeted for early 2026. An interesting insight from these developments is management's downward revision of full-year 2025 guidance due to slower automotive ramp-ups and the conclusion of legacy contracts, despite emphasizing strong technology...
